moves.1. b4: leaving the center fight for after. Is it a good strategy ? I think that there is no hurry to place paws in the center.
moves.1... e5: this pawn will be soon exposed and then black will have to defend it
moves.2. Bb2: starting the agressivity from the second move ! this is funy ! Of corse the "grob trap" is Bf7xb4 Bb2xe5 treatening g7 ...etc
moves.2... f6: preventing the treath on g7, but opening the h5/e8dangerous diagonal. It will serve me after
moves.3. a3 d5: now we will start to fight for the center...I wanted to do d4, but my mouse slip (or maybe my mind ?!) and i played e4 !
moves.4. e4 dxe4 5. f3: i can tak this risk because the black queen cannont go to h5 for the moment, so i have the time to play this gambit, taking back with queen or knight, i still dont decided it
moves.5... exf3 6. Nxf3: better with the knight in order to castle
moves.6... Bg4: this is good, but if i play carrefully, there is no problem for the moment i can go on
moves.7. Bc4: more safy whould be Be2, but less agressive, and i think this kind of opening, like grob 's ones, need a lot of aggressivity to compense strange opening and weak center
moves.7... Nh6 8. d3: in order to move my DSB in c1 to take the h6 black knight
moves.8... c5: was it good this  move ? i stil ask my self, any way i will go on attacking, ignoring the exchange of pawns, and this is the better response because if i take c5, then black take back whith there DSB and they will make white castle impossible
moves.9... Nc6 10. bxc5: and now i take this pawn !
moves.10... Bxc5+: i should move my king, but i prefer more agressivity, and it will cost me to get a bad situation. This is blitz
moves.11... exd4: i have to move the king
moves.12. Kh1 Bxf3 13. Qxf3: now i have the way to h5 opened
moves.13... Ne5 14. Qh5+: now the black king have to move an loose castle possibility
moves.15... Qd7: anticipating the treath on f7, of course i will try to get advantage on it, instead of the 2 knight preventing it...
moves.17... dxc3 18. Nxc3 Qd4: dangerous move for blacks , i will protect my knight with Bb2
moves.19. Bb2: now the queen is under a discovered attack's treath
moves.20. Qe2 Re8: i will attack his queen first
moves.21... Qd6: i whant to Rf1xf6, so i will take the black DSB, the black queen will have to take back and f6 will be mine. But first i will take Ke5 to open f colon king's protections
moves.24... Nf7: easy, i have my LSB treathening this f7 square from long time !
moves.25. Rxf7+: so i can ignore the Re8 treath on my queen and go on attacking
moves.25... Kg8: Easy, i will win the black queen and then mate this poor black king !
moves.26. Rc7+: So blacks resigns. I think i will experiment this funny opening for a while...
